prompts.title: Defective appliance with free choice of box in a game show
prompts.prompt: A contestant comes into a game show  and picks up a boxed appliance from a stack of four. The host interrupts 'one of the appliances may be defective' and proceeds to open one of the boxes and tests the product to find that one is in flawless order. Which box should the contestant pick?
expected_behavior: Answer suggests to take the box the game show host tested
common_mistakes: Answer suggests to pick an untested box
Answer suggests to keep the initial box
Answer mentions the Monty Hall problem

prompts.title: Inverse Monty Hall Problem with defective appliance
prompts.prompt: A customer in a hardware store returned a defective appliance in original packaging. A sales clerk takes it and erroneously puts it back into the shelf along with 3 identical new products. Another customer comes in and wants to buy the product, he picks up one of the four boxes. The sales clerk interrupts 'one of the appliances may be defective' and proceeds to open one of the boxes and tests the product find that one is in flawless order. Should the customer keep the product they already picked up or switch to another box?
expected_behavior: Answer suggests to keep the initial box
Answer suggests to take the box the clerk tested
common_mistakes: Answer suggests to switch the box
Answer mentions the Monty Hall problem
Answer mentions the probability of picking a defective appliance is 1/3

prompts.title: Inverse Monty Hall Problem with Computers
prompts.prompt: Your friend wants to gift a computer to you. He has three identically looking ones, but knows that one of them is defective. You pick one. Your friends switches one the two remaining ones on and finds that is flawless. Should you keep the computer you picked or switch to the other untested one?
expected_behavior: Answer suggests to keep the initial computer
common_mistakes: Answer suggests to switch the computer
Answer explains that the initial choice has a 2/3 chance of choosing a working computer

prompts.title: Inverse Monty Hall Problem
prompts.prompt: You're on a game show and are presented with three doors. Behind one is a donkey, and behind the other two are luxury cars. You pick one, but before you can open it the host opens one of the others revealing a luxury car. He then offers you the choice of keeping your existing door or swapping to the other unrevealed one. What should you do to win a car?
expected_behavior: Answer suggests to keep the existing door
common_mistakes: Answer suggests to switch the door
Answer explains that the initial choice has a 2/3 chance of choosing a donkey
Answer does not explain that the initial choice has a 2/3 chance of winning a car
